job.job_title: Project Coordinator | APS 5 | Collection management project
job.job_skills: Team leadership, collection management, library / archives
job.job_description:
I am working with a cultural institution to find an APS 5 Project Coordinator to work on one of their collection management projects.

This is an initial contract through until 31 December 2023 with the possibility of further work beyond this date.

In this contract, be responsible for:
  • Managing 3 x APS 3 project officers
  • QA of completed spreadsheets
  • Being a decision maker when it comes to how the collection is organised
  • Using your previous archives / library experience to assist with getting this project completed
In order to have your application considered:
  • You must have had previous experience working in a library or archive environment
  • Experience working within a cultural institution will be highly regarded
  • You must be able to commence within the next few weeks
  • Previous experience with leading a small team would be an advantage
For more information, please call Jemma Rowe at Ignite on 02 6113 7512.

My client is a global company and on their North Ryde Laboratory facility they are seeking a Laboratory Admin assistant to work for three departments “Microbiology, Fermentation and Chemistry”.
 
Working with an easy going , highly diverse team you will support and manage the workflow including sending out samples, purchase order system, stock ordering and GR invoices (Goods Received Invoices) along with input into internal sample registries and flagging strange results to the relevant people / department.
 
The role will report to the Microbiology team leader and up the line to the Scientific Services Manager.
 
Seeking a person to join their team who has the following values.
 
  • Seeks to continually improve.
  • Stretches oneself.
  • Consistent & Controlled in approach.
  • Respectful of others
  • Team player
 
Note: This position is not a Hybrid role, Monday to Friday flexible on working hours as long 40 hours a week a completed.
 
Experience:
 
  • Previously worked in a similar work environment
  • Worked with Purchase Ordering systems.
  • Worked with accounting software (prefer SharePoint)
  • Experience of ordering scientific equipment/stock or similar - beneficial
 
Duties:
 
  • Creating PO numbers in the system in preparation of ordering.
  • Preparing samples to be sent out for external analysis.
  • Ordering materials as requested, and by keeping track of inventories.
  • Processing of invoices according to the system, including using SharePoint to communicate with Accounts Payable.
  • Updating the materials inventory/ register when new supplies come in.
  • Build relationships with representatives of the main suppliers in case of issues.
  • Data input from outsource reports into internal sample registries.
  • Strange results are flagged to the relevant people (with experience).
  • Updating of databases with historical information (files, pictures, numbers, etc.)
 
 
If you are available immediate and have the required work rights to accept a permanent position and the experience and skill set to complete the above duties and want to work for a great team and interesting working environment.
 
Send your “Word “ formatted resume immediately to the apply button now.
 
For a confidential discussion call Michael Knight on 0432 795163 now.

job.job_skills: Collection management, Excel, attention to detail
job.job_description:
I am working with a cultural institution to findan APS 4 Library Project Officer. 

This is a contract position to commence within the next few weeks, and will go until end December 2023.  There is the possibility of extension into the new year. 

In this position, you'll be required to:
  • Retrieve collection material from the stacks
  • QA the work of other team members 
  • Rehouse the collection into new boxes / containers
  • Label the collection boxes / containers

job.job_title: Lead Security Architect - Air Traffic Solutions
job.job_description:
Lead Security Architect - Air Traffic Solutions

We are seeking applications from lead security Architects for our client - a well-established, multinational company that works across a range of different sectors. They are a leading provider of systems, products and services in the defence, security, and civil markets within Australia and throughout the world.

Our client is building a complex solution related to aviation and the lead Security architect will be responsible for developing high level security architecture and contribute to the design of the preliminary and detailed designs of the solution as required in coordination with the engineering team, other specialty engineering disciplines such as safety and human factors, and Security Authority.

Interested candidate have the option to pick either permanent or contract employment. The job offers excellent salary package/daily rates.
Australian Citizenship is required or likely to obtain within 6 months.

Skills and experience required for the role:
  • Advanced knowledge of IT systems security and software security architectures.
  • CISSP, CISM, SABSA, CompTIA Security+, CCNA Security, GIAC, or similar
  • knowledge of Australian Government Information Security Manual (ISM) and DSM.
  • Experience with System Engineering Process and Engineering life cycle.
  • Must be eligible for security clearance, so we are looking for Australian citizens Or who are in the process of obtaining citizenship in the near future.
  • Experience with host based and network-based security solutions and products.
  • Experience with authoring/reviewing technical documentation.
Desirable skills:
  • Experience with Standard Operating Environments and Core Operating Systems (Windows and/or Linux).
  • Experience with Security Monitoring, logging, Security Incidents and Event Management, and managed security services.
  • Experience with Authentication, Authorisation and Access management systems in Linux and/or Windows environment.
  • Experience in Defence security including cross domain security in Defence classified environment.
  • Experience with frameworks such as ITIL, AUSDAF, TOGAF, DODAF, eTOM , SABSA
Should this opportunity align with your skills and experience please contact Dwayne Joyce at dwayne.joyce@igniteco.com

job.job_description:
Our client - world's leading engineering consulting firm - is seeking applications from Security consultants for their Sydney or Melbourne offices. To be successful in this role you will have previous experience working in large Consulting firms where providing the right advice, managing projects, sticking to budgets is just a way of life for you. Your day to day will include designing electronic cyber secure security systems (cameras, card readers), advisory work (risk assessments, market scans of products, strategizing) and report writing.

It is permanent job with excellen salary package and benefits.

PROJECT ENGINEER - Mechanical OR Chemical OR Environmental OR Civil 
 
  • Water and Wastewater treatment (Mandatory)
  • Amazing Employee benefits
  • NSW location - Sutherland
  • 3 - 5 years post grad experience

Our client is an Australian success story specialising in the design, construction and delivery of Water and Wastewater Treatment Systems, predominantly in the Industrial, Food Processing and Municipal (Local Government) Sectors.

Due to continue growth and success of the company, an exciting and rewarding opportunity now presents itself to join their friendly team as a Project Engineer located in Sutherland NSW , Darra QLD O

You will be responsible for:
  • Working closely with existing Project Managers and other team members to ensure complete satisfaction of project design, construction and delivery of projects.
  • Managing the relationship with sub-contractors, suppliers and colleagues to ensure complete satisfaction of project design, construction and delivery of projects.
  • Organising and sourcing equipment suppliers, and transport of equipment to projects all around Australia.
  • Preparation of detailed Engineering designs and related documentation.
  • Managing your own smaller projects.

You will have:
  • Degree qualifications in Mechanical OR Chemical OR Environmental OR Civil Engineering.
  • A good Knowledge of equipment used in the Water and Wastewater industry.
  • A professional and hardworking approach.
  • Excellent clear English written and verbal communication skills to liaise directly with suppliers, subcontractors, clients and colleagues.
  • A strong ability to work unsupervised and in a team environment.
  • A passion for continuing with Water and Wastewater Industry knowledge and education.
  • Proficient with AutoCAD software and MS Office.
  • Experience in Engineering contract management.
  • Must have a car license and own transport.
  • Able to travel interstate and overseas for projects at times.

Employee Benefits
  • Free Public Transport from Day 1.
  • Free Income Protection from Day 1.
  • Free Life Insurance from Day 1.
  • 4 days study leave every year.
  • Free mobile phone and phone plan from Day 1.
  • Free top of the range Laptop with all the latest software from Day 1 which you can keep after 3 year of service and receive upgraded Lap top for business.
  • Free ongoing in-house training by Industry experts.
  • No set start and finish times. 
  • 3 months paid maternity leave and 2 weeks paid paternity leave for all employees.

This is a special opportunity to join a Company that understands the importance of its people in its continued success and growth.

Be mentored by some of the best Engineers in the Water and Wastewater Industry here in Australia.

The Business Analyst is responsible for helping define business problems via in-depth investigation and gathering of technical and non-technical information with specific focus on the Fraud domain.  This is a key role to assist in the delivery of diverse and varied program of work, centred around a large-scale fraud investigation capability uplift.

  • Working with Agile delivery practices including backlog creation / refinement and associated requirements gathering, data discovery and analysis.
  • Facilitate workshops and perform business analysis activities including business process modelling, business and solution requirements lifecycle management, and data modelling.
  • Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and features.
  • Suggest changes/enhancements to Senior Management using analytics to support your recommendations and actively participate in the implementation of approved changes.
 
Essential Criteria
 
  • Demonstrated experience working in a similar role supporting the successful delivery of high-impact and high-value initiatives that lead to meaningful change, with a proven ability to use initiative and self-drive to meet demanding deadlines.
  • Proven experience, of greater than 3 years, in a senior role relating to fraud investigations, case management and data mining including delivery of new services and ongoing feature elaboration.
  • Experience with Cloud environments Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services.
  • Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills including the ability to effectively liaise and keep stakeholders informed and engaged, both verbally and in writing.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment, cultivating productive working relationships across multiple projects and business areas.
  • Demonstrated experience in elicitation of business requirements and acceptance criteria using varying techniques including workshops.
  • Experience in working with diverse project, in-house development, and vendor teams to empower delivery of business benefit.

job.job_title: Senior Project Manager - Government Health Care Agency
job.job_description:
Senior Project Manager – Government Health Care Agency


Primary purpose of the role:

  • Initiate, design, deliver, manage, and control a project through its lifecycle. Develop relevant plans and monitor and control in line with the approved baseline. Ensure that risks and issues are promptly addressed, and project deliverables and objectives are achieved.
Key accountabilities:
 
  • Understand how the project aligns to the business strategy and facilitate the development of the Business Case. Develop the project management plan ensuring an efficient and effective resource profile and project schedule.
  • Project Governance. Work with the Business Owner to set up the monitoring and governance routines, delivery of high-quality progress reporting and insights, and effective chairing of the project steering committee to make decisions and resolve issues to drive towards outcomes.
  • Project Management. Be accountable for the delivery of the project objectives against the baselined scope, cost, schedule, and deliverables, ensuring disciplined and high-quality management across key compliance and project management standards. Use approved processes and effective stakeholder communication to manage any variance against the baseline.
  • Resource Management. Work with and forecast to line managers the resource requirements, including vendors, for the project, developing an efficient profile supported by effective scheduling and integrated into schedule and cost management tools.
  • Risk Management. Identify, respond, and manage all associated risks, assumptions, and issues on the projects. Develop, manage, and undertake regular reviews of the project risk register, and escalate risks in accordance with agreed frameworks.
  • Dependency management. Manage dependencies and interdependencies across the project, driving the agreement and management of both inbound and outbound dependencies to ensure a successful schedule and ability to realise the project objectives.
  • Stakeholder Communication. Develop and provide regular communication and engagement with the business owner, through the delivery of professional, accurate updates on progress, as well as and responsive advice, explanation, and guidance.
 
Essential requirements:

Qualification in Project Management (Prince2, PMBOK).
Highly developed collaborative and partnering approach to stakeholder management.
Pre-employment checks.
A range of experience in project management i.e., minimum 10 years
Tertiary level qualifications at degree level in business management or related discipline or equivalent knowledge, skills and experience acquired through extensive experience.
 
Should this opportunity align with your skills and experience please contact Dwayne Joyce at dwayne.joyce@igniteco.com

We are currently recruiting customer service superstars for contract based positions in Newcastle! Initial 3 month contract with high potential to extend.

If you can easily adapt to new environments, enjoy variety in your work, and are available immediately, then this could be the opportunity for you!

  • Proficient in MS Office
  • Good team player
  • High attention to detail
  • Resolve enquiries, providing accurate and timely responses
  • Experience in high volume environment
  • Happy to work full time on site

Let Ignite help find that perfect position for you and APPLY NOW.
Due to the nature of the current volume of application only candidates who match the specific criteria will be contacted.

HSEQ Coordinator

Our client, a reputable construction company with over 45 years of successful operations in Sydney, is known for their commitment to quality, safety, and integrity within the industry.
They specialize in a wide range of projects, including electrical substations, local government buildings, sporting infrastructure, warehouses, commercial projects, and refurbishments.
With a diverse project portfolio and a strong pipeline of work across multiple sectors, they are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced HSEQ Coordinator to join their friendly, driven, and energetic team.

Role and Responsibilities:

As an HSEQ Coordinator, you will report directly to the HSEQ Manager and play a crucial role in ensuring safety, quality, and environmental compliance across all project sites.

Your responsibilities will include:
  • Conducting safety, quality, and environmental inspections, ensuring consistent adherence to site setup procedures across all projects.
  • Assisting staff, site teams, and contractors in complying with relevant legislation, standards, and contractual arrangements.
  • Supporting the HSEQ Manager in delivering the Safety Management System, including policies, procedures, manuals, and practices.
  • Acting as a company representative for all WHS matters.
  • Proactively assisting work teams in implementing and embedding health and safety work plans.
  • Keeping up-to-date with legislative changes and continuously reviewing and improving policies and procedures.
  • Monitoring compliance with organizational policies and procedures.
  • Providing workplace safety, health, environmental, and quality support and advice to the Senior Management Team and staff.
  • Assisting in assurance and audit activities within the company.
  • Contributing to the development, review, and monitoring of the HSEQ Plan and objectives and targets.
Requirements: To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and skills:
  • Minimum Cert. IV in workplace safety.
  • Knowledge of HSEQ processes and previous experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrated unwavering commitment to health and safety.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced office environment.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities.
  • Related industry experience, particularly in commercial and civil construction (highly desirable).
  • Current driver's license.
  • National Construction General Induction Card (All States Recognized).
This is a unique opportunity to join an award-winning team, make a significant contribution to various projects, and enjoy a vibrant and dynamic work environment.

How to Apply: If you are passionate about ensuring safety, quality, and compliance within the construction industry and possess the required qualifications and skills, we would love to hear from you.

Click on quick apply and Please submit your WORD Formatted resume, along with a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role.
Join our client's team and be part of their ongoing success by applying today!
Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you for your understanding.
